column4: [   47.416000] ACPI: PCI interrupt for device 0000:03:00.0 disabled how do I prevent this so my wireless will work?
what does that have to do with your wireless, if I may ask?
device 0000:03:00.0 is my AR5006EG wireless pci express card that uses madwifi driver
anything from madwifi in dmesg?
I'd think that would be the message of interest
well there is a message about ath_pci "[   47.388000] ath_pci: 0.9.4.5 (0.9.3.2)". I found this info about the bug http://madwifi.org/ticket/838#comment:11 but it says it was fixed those after 0.9.2
mm, if madwifi does not work out for you, try ndiswrapper
what is odd i'm using ethernet yet lspci says its unknown and my eth is eth8 now but it was 6  then 7 and changes every boot
sounds familiar
tell me your laptop model?
anyone can use ndiswrapper for most cards but this card is fully supported according to manufacturer and madwifi docs
can you pastebin your dmesg?
what laptop model are you?
sure
presario F756NR laptop
gimme a sec for that eth issue
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=583920&page=4 post #34
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/50695/ dmesg stuff
well, "Hardware revision not supported"
you may have to use ndiswrapper, some AR5006EGs are actually AR5007EG
the status of the latter is a bit iffy I think
http://www.atheros.cz/
brb

tried something lame and wireless still not working however dmesg mentioned '[   13.626004] PCI: If a device doesn't work, try "pci=routeirq".  If it helps, post a report" perhaps I could try doing that to get the wireless working?
